pros:
Vacation is generous as are holidays. 
Access to CEUs and training - I never have to worry about CEUs at all and get training in evidence-based practices.
Supportive management.
cons: Cost of family plan and no option for a couples only plan for health insurance.

pros: Work from home Work independently and own pace. Coworkers are pretty chill, some managers as well.
cons: Pays okay Deal with a lot of mental health individuals Need to visit mental health patients

review_title: The pay is terrible for a lot of work
pros: The work is rewarding for the most part Flexible on hours
cons: Lack of pay Strict on time off, even if you have a medical condition 6 months before you can use PTO

pros: Flexible hours Good benefits Health insurance
cons: Salary Facilities staff can be rude When short staffed one person will have to do the work of three for no additional compensation Executive leadership is very disconnected from community programs Only one HR staff for over 500 employees. Inappropriate relationships amongst supervisors and staff Favoritism/discrimination when promoting Inconsistent management Reactionary policies Don’t care about staff or population served.

pros: For community mental health, the salary is good.
cons: Poor communication, favoritism of employees, weird hour requirements

pros: Flexibility with scheduling, and work life balance.
cons: Changes in procedure can slow down productivity at times.

pros: If your new to the field it’s a good way to gain experience
cons: No regular pay raises, policies are very reactionary rather than proactive. They’ll hire anyone.

pros: They are very flexible and understanding and will work with you.
cons: Not the greatest starting pay.

pros: Great supervision staff Fair pay for a nonprofit
cons: Poor communication, instability of staffing

review_title: Good if you are looking to get your foot out the door
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Norton, MA
pros: Easy application and interview process I liked my coworkers
cons: Getting a raise is almost impossible. They pay new workers more than workers who have been here for years.

pros:
Everything about CCBC!

This is the absolute BEST nonprofit that I have worked for. They care about their employees, clients and the care that is put into every service. 

They believe in ALL of their employees and truly create an inclusive environment.
cons: There really weren't any cons.

review_title: CCBC makes a difference in the communities they serve.
pros: Non-Profit, Focus and dedication to community improvement stating at the individual level.
cons: Non-Profit, overly dependent upon tax payer funds, understaffed.

job_title: Recovery Bridger in North Attleboro, MA
pros: Understanding supervisors, rewarding work, decent vacation accrual
cons: Medical is not great, not very flexible

pros:
-Flexibility and independence in manging your caseload
-Monday-Friday 9-5 schedule
-Experience gained is invaluable and many CSP employees are head-hunted by other agencies
-3 weeks of vacation accrued per year for first 2 years, then 4 weeks; 10 paid sick days accrued annually; high mileage reimbursement
cons:
-Management is unconcerned with keeping staff/sees staff as replaceable -- very, very high turnover rate
-Pay is lower than comparable jobs in the state
-Job responsibilities change often with little training offered on new responsibilities
-No formal training program makes the job very stressful early on; staff is forced to use a "learn as you go" approach
-Health insurance has a large deductible
-Little support from upper management

review_title: Good work culture with terrible management support
pros: Outstanding community of colleagues.  Flexible schedules and competent providers.  Great experience in community-based care. Great for beginners.  Great networking opportunity.
cons: Bottom-line billing quotas were enforced regardless of any other consideration.  Health insurance was laughable.  Management could and would make assurances or promises and then did not hold up their end.  Constant travel destroys your vehicle.

review_title: Mismanaged, tone-deaf when it comes to employee needs.
pros: For the most part, front line workers are committed to their work. Benefits are halfway decent, although the pay is horrendous.
cons: At best, the executive management team is tone deaf to employees' needs.  At worst, they are downright hostile.  As others have said, policies seem to be arbitrary and unfair. I saw several people get fired for no reason. It was heart breaking. They were literally reminded that they are "employed at will" and let go for no other reason. Also, if you are looking for upward mobility, look elsewhere.  Open positions are frequently filled from the outside.

pros: Allows college graduates exposure to mental health/substance abuse treatment plans and daily work necessary to coincide with the planse
cons: Good employees are forced to seek other employment due to unfair reporting of clients and supervisors with no chance of an employee ever being to defend themselves against false accusations.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Taunton, MA
pros: Strong feeling of team. Middle management very supportive. Challenging clients, but rewarding work. Developed long term friendships with fellow staff members. Many employees show a strong commitment to the clients. Company instituted training sessions to improve performance of local division.
cons: Upper management could have a better understanding of employee needs. Upper management seems disconnected from issues concerning employee satisfaction.

pros: Amazing program manager who truly cares about the population served and employees. She works so hard and sincerely aims to make decisions in the best interests of the clients.
cons: The pay. Just the pay. But the flexibility and paid time off are helpful in that respect. The health insurance is pretty bad, but 403B is pretty good!

pros:
Learning how to work with all kinds of mental health populations and how to document paperwork properly.
Excellent with providing time off.
cons: The Pay is terrible and you do not get to hone in on a specific population that you feel you can work better with.

pros: Flexible supervisors, client base is great, you get to help others!
cons: not much movement in pay, the medical is terrible, and too much demand for the pay

pros: Sparse benefits w high deductibles targeted to the desperate.
cons: Favoritism, lack on confidentiality, exceedingly poor management, high turnover. If you’re a student looking for experience I’d suggest you look elsewhere.

review_title: A good place to gain experience
pros: Compassionate organization, provides decent benefits.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement.  Management is inconsistent.

pros: Great people and benefits.  Supportive environment.
cons: Administrative staff has no opportunity for growth.  No feedback from supervisors.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Foxboro, MA
pros: Client focused, fair starting pay, community based, earned time off, generous holiday compensation
cons: Difficult to schedule in house training.

pros: good team environment awesome employees
cons: not much area for growth or raises

job_title: Therapeutic Mentor/Therapeutic Training and Support Counselor in Taunton, MA
pros: Great supervision, excellent benefits, rewarding job.
cons: Salary is low and it can be overly regulated.

pros: Flexibility, benefits, location, commute, team work
cons: Salary, salary, salary, salary, salary

pros: help build up experience
cons: unpredictable schedule, late nights, stressful

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in East Taunton, MA
pros: Good place to develop emerging professional skills
cons: Pay and benefits are non existent
